alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades; Northwest Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 09 at 7:31AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...HEAVY RAINFALL TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY WITH RISING STREAMS AND RIVERS... Heavy rain is expected over the Cascades tonight through early Saturday and then across the Blue Mountains and portions of eastern Oregon and Washington Saturday Saturday into Sunday. The heaviest rain looks to occur tonight into early Friday for the Washington Cascades during the day Friday for the Oregon Cascades during the day Saturday over eastern Oregon, with a second round on Sunday. Rainfall amounts of 0.50 to 1.00 inches are expected across the outlook area, with higher amounts possible over the mountains. Rivers continue to run high across all of southeast Washington and central and northeast Oregon due to the recent wet conditions. The additional rainfall is expected to bring the Naches River close to or above flood stage and bring rises on portions of the Yakima River. Additionally, many rivers remain close to or above bankfull and will continue to run fast and high. Campers, hikers and those planning outdoor activities should keep advised of developing showers and seek higher ground, if necessary. Never camp along streams, rivers and creeks. Keep an eye on children and pets to make sure they do not get too close to the water`s edge.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades; Northwest Blue Mountains
